page.title: 15Animals on the Farm
page.content: PIGS Pigs get served 2 and 1/2 times a year.They need someone with them whilst they have their piglets.The pens are scraped out twice a day,and we take 2 or 3 wheel barrows of pig muck out every day .The pigs are big and bristly and the piglets are silky.They eat nuts and whilst they are feeding they make a lot of noise. HENS We have 3 pens of hens.The hens are fed 1 bucket of food a day, and they drink a watering can full of water.We collect the eggs 3 times a day.The hens lay their eggs in funny places:- behind the door, in the wood pile. GOATS Goats are shy animals.They live on farms and eat hay.They will also eat lots of rubbish. Baby goats are called Kids.Our goats don't like the geese.
